page.title: 07The Doctors' Surgery, Otford
page.content: When we went to the Doctors' Surgery our group found out quite a lot of useful information. For instance, the Surgery was built in 1968. Here are some other things we found out: 11 people work there - four doctors and seven people in the office. The building has always been a surgery. They haven't got a computer, just a filing system. Not many people are sent off to hospital immediately. Mixed age-groups visit them with roughly 100 people coming to the Surgery each day. The secretary who answered our questions said that they get patients from most of the surrounding villages. There is a nurse who comes in three times a week to do the injections, etc. and there are two District Nurses who . see to the needs of the old people.
